The approach we take corresponds to the following process. We move probability mass from the leftmost, then uppermost entry with non-zero mass to its right neighbor in the server table. So, for example, in TableÂ 2, as VÂ¯câ€‹[i]subscriptÂ¯ğ‘‰ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–\overline{V}_{c}[i] increases from 0, we first move mass from the entry HÂ¯câ€‹[i]=2,XÂ¯câ€‹[i]=1formulae-sequencesubscriptÂ¯ğ»ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–2subscriptÂ¯ğ‘‹ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–1\overline{H}_{c}[i]=2,\overline{X}_{c}[i]=1 to the entry HÂ¯câ€‹[i]=2,XÂ¯câ€‹[i]=2formulae-sequencesubscriptÂ¯ğ»ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–2subscriptÂ¯ğ‘‹ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–2\overline{H}_{c}[i]=2,\overline{X}_{c}[i]=2. That is, the client, based on its private randomness, increases the probability of message XÂ¯câ€‹[i]=2subscriptÂ¯ğ‘‹ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–2\overline{X}_{c}[i]=2 and decreases the probability of message XÂ¯câ€‹[i]=1subscriptÂ¯ğ‘‹ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–1\overline{X}_{c}[i]=1 when HÂ¯câ€‹[i]=2subscriptÂ¯ğ»ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–2\overline{H}_{c}[i]=2. The amount of mass moved is always chosen to maintain unbiasedness.
At some point, as VÂ¯câ€‹[i]subscriptÂ¯ğ‘‰ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–\overline{V}_{c}[i] increases, all of the probability mass will have moved, and then we start moving mass from HÂ¯câ€‹[i]=3,XÂ¯câ€‹[i]=1formulae-sequencesubscriptÂ¯ğ»ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–3subscriptÂ¯ğ‘‹ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘–1\overline{H}_{c}[i]=3,\overline{X}_{c}[i]=1 similarly.
